Description: Rim sherd of Attic pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black band on top of rim; silhouette decoration in lip zone consisting of dancing male figures (left arm and part of head of one dancer missing, to right; of second dancer, only one hand and leg remain); below, narrow black band at junction with handle zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 16)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 389, no. B558)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1356) (phase 3)
